jarvis.tools package¶

Submodules¶

jarvis.tools.get_potcar module¶

jarvis.tools.vasp module¶

jarvis.tools.vasp.IP_optics(vrun='', filename='.', extra='', plot=False)[source]¶

Optoelectronic properties derived from dielectric function

See http://www.wien2k.at/reg_user/textbooks/WIEN2k_lecture-notes_2013/optic_handout.pdf http://www.phys.ufl.edu/~tanner/Wooten-OpticalPropertiesOfSolids-2up.pdf

Parameters:vrun – path to vasprun.xml
Reurns:
info: dictionary with optoelectronic information energy: energy bins generally 0 to 40 eV real_part: real part of dielectric function imag_part: imaginary part of dielectric function absorption: absorption coefficient in cm^-1

TODO: shorten the code with multi-dimensional np array

jarvis.tools.vasp.bandgap(vrun='', occu_tol=0.001)[source]¶

Parses vasprun.xml and gives bandgap

Parameters:
  • vrun – path to vasprun.xml
  • occu_tol – occupation tolerance
Returns:

bandgap direct: direct/indirect bandgap
Return type:

eg
jarvis.tools.vasp.bandstr(vrun='', kpfile='', filename='.', plot=False)[source]¶

Plot electronic bandstructure

Parameters:
  • vrun – path to vasprun.xml
  • kpfile – path to line mode KPOINTS file
Returns:

matplotlib object
jarvis.tools.vasp.elastic_props(outcar='', vacuum=False)[source]¶

Obtain elastic tensor and calculate related properties

Parameters:
  • outcar – OUTCAR file path
  • vacuum – whether the structure has vaccum such as 2D materials
  • vacuum structures bulk and shear mod. needs extra attenstion (for) –
  • elastic tensor are in Nm^-1 rather than GPa (and) –
Returns:

data for elastic tensor (in string and object representation), bulk, shear modulus, and phonon modes
Return type:

info
jarvis.tools.vasp.get_area(strt='')[source]¶

Get area of a Structure object along z-direction

Parameters:strt – Structure object
Returns:area
jarvis.tools.vasp.get_spacegroup(strt='')[source]¶

Get spacegroup of a Structure pbject

Parameters:strt – Structure object
Returns:spacegroup number symb: spacegroup symbol
Return type:num
jarvis.tools.vasp.magnetic_moment(oszicar='')[source]¶

Obtain total orbital magnetic moment Magnetic moment info is found in both OSZICAR and OUTCAR We prefer OSZICAR values

Parameters:oszicar – path to OSZICAR
Returns:orbital magnetic moment in Bohr-magneton
Return type:magmom
jarvis.tools.vasp.plot_dos(vrun='', low_lim=-5, up_lim=10, filename='.', extra='', plot=False)[source]¶

Plot total density of states

Parameters:
  • vrun – vasprun.xml path
  • low_lim – lower energy limit in eV
  • up_lim – upper energy limit in eV
Returns:

matplotlib objects for total, orbital and element project density of states
jarvis.tools.vasp.plot_enc_convergence(directory='../vasp/examples/SiOptb88/', plot=False, filename='.')[source]¶

Plot convergence for plane-wave cut-off data Works only if jobs run through jarvis-tools framework

Parameters:directory – parent directory for job run
Returns:matplotlib object, converged cut-off value
jarvis.tools.vasp.plot_kp_convergence(directory='../vasp/examples/SiOptb88/', plot=False, filename='.')[source]¶

Plot convergence for k-points data Works only if jobs run through jarvis-tools framework

Parameters:directory – parent directory for job run
Returns:matplotlib object, converged k-points value
